page.title: 08Natural Resources;Slievemeel
page.content: The granite quarry (318288) on the North side of Slieve Bearnagh has been an increasing scar on the landscape. Recent planning permission has insisted that only already-cut blocks be removed: no further blasting is allowed. Local farmers take a little sand and gravel from a small pit in the glacial till at 3132999, mainly for repairing farm tracks. Fofanny reservoir is part of the water supply system. It has an earth dam and the level of water fluctuates widely in response to rainfall as it has a fairly small catchment area and is a shallow reservoir. Water from this reservoir feeds via the Muddock River into Lough Island Reavy, thence to Portadown and Banbridge. Fofanny reservoir supplies about 1.7 million gallons per day into the system.
